document.p: Performs computations on a single input value.
Abs: computes the absolute value of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Length: computes the norm of the input. On scalars, this is equivalent to Abs.
Normalize: returns the input vector scaled according to its norm. It is not a valid operation on scalars.
Invert: inverts the sign of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Sin: computes the sine of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Cos: computes the cosine of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Tan: computes the tangent of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Asin: computes the arcsine of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Acos: computes the arccosine of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Atan: computes the arctangent of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Exp: computes the exponential function on the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Radians: converts the input value from degrees to radians. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Degrees: converts the input value from radians to degrees. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Floor: computes the floor function of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
Ceil: computes the ceiling function of the input. If the input is a vector, the result is computed component-wise.
X: extracts the X component from the input. It is not a valid operation on scalars.
Y: extracts the Y component from the input. It is not a valid operation on scalars.
Z: extracts the Z component from the input. It is not a valid operation on scalars.
